data.title: Joseph J. Watson II on LinkedIn: The Story Behind Rasheed Wallace SIGNING With NIKE
data.meta_description: 26 years ago I was commissioned with getting a logo created for then Portland Trailblazer star Rasheed Wallace. To this day, the Sheed Air Force One is one of‚Ä¶
data.text:
Friday, June 21, 2024, Philadelphia, PA I would like to thank God Almighty for allowing this event to take place without incident. A lot of questions were answered, a lot of connections were made and there's more to come. Our first Community Conversations to discuss solutions for gun violence in the city of Philadelphia was held this past Friday. Thank you @iam_sheeeeeed for providing us with your vision. I would like to thank my partners @the_coachali @kfc6323 @twallace45 @g2msports @moodynwatsonllc #melissa. Thank you @hartoflifefoundation @got_95hart @lynardstewart for keeping my Aunt Jackie's vision going with the Basketball Clinic üëèüèøü´°üíØ. Thank you to our Town Hall Sponsor @cindybassphilly @darrylshuler215. Thank you @sustudiosofficial for the Town Hall flyer! Thank you to our wonderful panelist @a.cartersteward @ankamahjr @chefwiz144 @iam_coachroc #KionaBuford #DionJones #DeAngeloHarris #CaptainJosephBusa of the 39th District and our wonderful moderator @eddieshouse215. Thank you to Philly District Attorney @larrykrasner for attending and salute ü´° to my brother from another mother Philly Deputy Police Commissioner Joel Dales. We are not done. We are looking to have more events, implement solutions and programs, and change more lives. I will leave you all with this if you have gotten this far down in the post, it's time to repent for all the wrong we have done because the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. ‚úåüèæ #rasheedwallace #simongratz #communityconservation #jackiewallacefoundation #philly #peaceinthestreets

Support a great cause in the city of Philadelphia. TCRC Community Healing Center food pantry has 3 community food distribution points within the city (West Philly, North Philly and North Central Temple area) that provide free food and groceries to over 5,000 citizens each week. The Center for Returning Citizens‚ÄîCommunity Healing Center (TCRC-CHC) In June of 2020, in the midst of the COVID-19 Pandemic, The Centerf for Returning Citizens‚ÄìCommunity Healing Center (TCRC-CHC) saw the need for food distribution centers in Philadelphia. Economic conditions, food scarcity and insecurity were major problems in the community. Through an association with Food Programs and other community resources, the food pantry was established. From these humble beginnings and through hard work and dedication to tasks, the food distribution program grew. Staffed by formerly incarcerated individuals, community volunteers and church member participants,, TCRC Community Healing Center Food pantry is currently the largest distribution point for community food that is organized by activists in the African-American community in the city of Philadelphia. Currently, TCRC serves between. 17,000 to 23,000 vulnerable children, adults, and seniors each month with nutritious foods. TCRC is conducting an end-of-the-year donation drive to fulfill its three core missions. Ending Food scarcity/Food Distribution Conflict resolution/stop the violence Reentry; support systems for the formerly incarcerated. Is it in food sca. Please help support this vital work. Your tax deductible contribution enables us to feed hungry families, impact the lives of troubled youth and support the dreams and aspirations of persons returning to freedom. Donations: PayPal.Me/tcrcphilly Venmo: @tcrcphilly Text may be mailed directly to: TCRC-CHC 3981 Nice St. Philadelphia PA 19140 Thanking you in advance for your generous donation
